I downloaded videos of professional play and reviewed them, idealizing and visualizing the \"ideal play\" or ways in which I would have played in that scenario. This in turn led to rapid improvement, allowing me to reaching the top echelons of a ranked player base of over 2 million. My talent, dedication, and work ethic caught the attention of top eSports organizations and eventually led to a contract as a paid professional. While playing for these teams, I experienced obstacles in the form of grueling scrim/practice blocks, which often consisted of competing against players in the main roster who were often significantly more skilled, experienced, and cohesive. Despite being consistently beaten, I used this adversity as a learning experience to improve my play, and my skills became well-known amongst the top professional players. I developed my skill by dedicating myself to improvement, and this philosophy and work ethic is something I wish to translate toward all my passions. Competition is an important part of my drive, and motivates me to work harder than everyone else. I have an innately strong drive and appetite for success, and I want to apply this ambition and passion to software engineering. import React, {Component} from 'react' class Collapsible extends Component{ constructor(props){ super(props); this.state = { open: false } this.togglePanel = this.togglePanel.bind(this); } togglePanel(e){ this.setState({open: !this.state.open}) } render(){ return(
this.togglePanel(e)} className="collapsible">

{this.props.title}

{this.state.open ? (
{this.props.children}
) : null }
) } } class Quote extends Component{ constructor(props){ super(props); } render(){ return(
"{this.props.children}"

― {this.props.author}

) } } export default class Experience extends Component{ render(){ return(
Thoughts (Click to Expand)

I used to be a Challenger League of Legends player (at my peak rating, I was ranked around 24 which is the top 0.013% of the ladder). I wasn’t naturally good - I initially started at the lowest rank and slowly developed my ability by deliberate practice. I downloaded videos of professional play and reviewed them, idealizing and visualizing the "ideal play" or ways in which I would have played in that scenario. This in turn led to rapid improvement, allowing me to reaching the top echelons of a ranked player base of over 2 million. My talent, dedication, and work ethic caught the attention of top eSports organizations and eventually led to a contract as a paid professional. While playing for these teams, I experienced obstacles in the form of grueling scrim/practice blocks, which often consisted of competing against players in the main roster who were often significantly more skilled, experienced, and cohesive. Despite being consistently beaten, I used this adversity as a learning experience to improve my play, and my skills became well-known amongst the top professional players. I developed my skill by dedicating myself to improvement, and this philosophy and work ethic is something I wish to translate toward all my passions. Competition is an important part of my drive, and motivates me to work harder than everyone else. I have an innately strong drive and appetite for success, and I want to apply this ambition and passion to software engineering. In fact, my passion for eSports played a large role in my decision to attend UCI!

Team Liquid 2016

Cloud9 Challenger 2016

Less, but better. The mind is like an umbrella. It's most useful when open. Design is not just what it looks like and feels like. Design is how it works. I think perfection is ugly. Somewhere in the things humans make, I want to see scars, failure, disorder, distortion. You can only go forward by making mistakes. I'm not that special. I can't convince everyone. I'm just going to do what I want to do and what will have the most impact. {/*
*/}
) } }
